intro: Psychotria mapourioides var. tobagensis, commonly known as the Toba psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
